title.narrative: Economic and social development of marginalised women and girls

description.narrative: The project is focused on promoting the financial inclusion through secured cooperative micro-finance services and will be implemented by two local partners in Northern and Southern provinces in Sri Lanka. Both organisations are working towards providing the credit and saving facilities targeting the poor women in the particular locations. Thus, the project aims to strengthen the self-banking and primary women branches in promoting the women and youth empowerment, improve the knowledge on the cooperative concept and making a gender sensitive society within the two organisations and as well as within the targeted communities. At the end of five years, it is expected to increase the access to fair financial resources for the marginalized rural women and have increased women led groups and sustainable women led enterprises in cooperative approach.

This project has proposed as a consortium project including the organisation ‘Sri Lanka Women Development Services Cooperative Society Limited’ – Women Coop and SMDF. Women Coop hasn’t shown up their interest to submit the project proposal to We Effect till end of July 2018. Anyhow, SMDF has submitted their proposal at the mid of August 2018, finally the project document of SMDF has been finalized in the mid of September. As per the project document SMDF has been started their project implementation from latter part of September. The project is focusing to implement their strategic plan with the objectives of 1. strengthening self bank societies. 2. improve staff efficiency and productivity 3. strengthening the board of the organisation 4. Empower women and youth 5. Developing gender sensitive society in SMDF 6. Developing cooperative based future leadership towards sustainability.

participating-org.narrative: Savisthri’ Women for Development Alternative, Law & Society Trust

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
